posts.post_content: @Takashi\_theDestroier: That wouldn't be infinite turns, since you'd have to make all the copies while the spell is on the stack, and you wouldn't get the lands back in play until you're taking those extra turns. But it could still potentially be a lot of turns, if you had the mana to cast both Time Stretch and copy it. And if you can't win with five turns in a row all to yourself, there's probably something wrong with your deck.
posts.html:
@Takashi_theDestroier: That wouldn't be infinite turns, since you'd have to make all the copies while the spell is on the stack, and you wouldn't get the lands back in play until you're taking those extra turns. But it could still potentially be a lot of turns, if you had the mana to cast both Time Stretch and copy it. And if you can't win with five turns in a row all to yourself, there's probably something wrong with your deck.

posts.post_content: Not for your everyday spell-copying like [twincast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=twincast) or [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter), but for those spells that will totally screw the opponent if you copy them more than once. For example, in-block [Eternal Dominion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Dominion), or some others like [Dichotomancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dichotomancy) or [Mind's Desire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind's Desire).
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Use sakura tribe scout to offset the land bounce, and then go nuts with the spell copying. There are also a couple tricks for sacrificing your opponents lands, ie if you have a genju card, enchant your opponents land, then steal it with a roo\*\*\*er matriarch. More than likely a sakura tribe scout will do the trick, and if you don't have that a coiling oracle can help too. Her ability also doesn't cause her to tap, so you can still attack with her 4/4 and flying after taking out your opponents creatures with say.. a forked rolling thunder.
posts.html:
Use sakura tribe scout to offset the land bounce, and then go nuts with the spell copying. There are also a couple tricks for sacrificing your opponents lands, ie if you have a genju card, enchant your opponents land, then steal it with a roo***er matriarch. More than likely a sakura tribe scout will do the trick, and if you don't have that a coiling oracle can help too. Her ability also doesn't cause her to tap, so you can still attack with her 4/4 and flying after taking out your opponents creatures with say.. a forked rolling thunder.

posts.post_content:
In my [Kami of the Crescent Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kami of the Crescent Moon) EDH deck one of my combos is:  
this + [Patron of the Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patron of the Moon) + [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor) + [any kind of mana doubler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=214345)  
  
Infinite mana and infinite copies of any spell you have in your hand (the prophet and mana doubler can be replaced by [Cloudstone Curio](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudstone Curio), if you just want infinite mana/landfall)  
  
i.e. Patron + Amulet + Curio = infinite mana/landfall
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
languill, Tunnel Vision wouldn't work, because it puts the named card back on top of their deck, and only milled what was above it - you'd have to name a different card to get past the one you named, and then copy it AGAIN, naming the one you know is on bottom.  
  
I'm sure Uyo has better things she can do, anyway

posts.post_content:
Great card to go with [Tunnel Vision](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tunnel Vision).
  
   
Put a card on the bottom of a players library, use tunnel vision, if they aren't milled out, send 2 land to your hand, do it again, repeat until its over.
